content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 9 to node 2 is:


```arduino
9 -> 5 -> 4
```
This path is the shortest because it uses only two edges (the first edge is from node 9 to node 5, and the second edge is from node 5 to node 4). It avoids using any of the longer edges in the graph. Note that this path is different from the original shortest path (1->2->3->4) because the endpoint has changed from node 4 to node 2.

The shortest path from node 9 to node 3 is:


```scss
9 -> 2 -> 3
```
This path uses the two shortest edges in the graph: the first edge from node 9 to node 2, and the second edge from node 2 to node 3. It avoids using any of the longer edges in the graph. Note that this path is different from the original shortest path (1->2->3->4) because the endpoint has changed from node 4 to node 3.
